item.title: Spark Java Web Framework
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

Ashi:

Spring is better.

u dont know what ur talking about. spring is suited to be deployed on the large scale and spark is meant for prototyping and small projects that dont require a massive underlying architecture…

[quote=“justaguy, post:6, topic:544657”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=663530.msg4434611#msg4434611 date=1404624443]

[quote author=sinisoul link=topic=663530.msg4434610#msg4434610 date=1404624312]

http://www.sparkjava.com

Based off Sinatra.
[/quote]Neat. But I doubt people using Java care much for minimalism and elegance :).

I think Java will move to be more functional in the future.
[/quote]Yeah but there are already tons of languages that fit the bill more appropriately. Java’s most popular in the enterprise. Not that this is bad or anything though.

I agree with this but that’s probably because I find Java being functional in some form or another kind of awkward.[/quote]

why? i thought function objects were intuitive

Read full topic
